verbs.description: deliquate (third-person singular simple present deliquates, present participle deliquating, simple past and past participle deliquated)

entries.meaning: (obsolete, transitive) To cause to melt away; to dissolve; to consume.
(obsolete, intransitive) To melt or be dissolved; to deliquesce.
examples: I caused an unusual brine to be made , by suffering sea - salt to deliquate in the moist air
